title: Health ministry reduces NEET PG cut-off to zero percentile for this year - Times of India
selftext:
You conduct an exam

You claim the exam will "filter" bad candidates

You also claim rich people with loads of money do not get seats automatically in private colleges

Finally you let everyone in.

What kind of fuckery is this? If you are letting everyone in, why need an entrance test?
comments: why should the government be concerned if rich people automatically get seats in private colleges ? I do not understand whats wrong with it.
Exactly, when a particular section can go-ahead with negative marks in various fields, what's wrong with money power? Atleast some medical colleges will make money.
And it will give employment to teachers. Not a bad idea to reduce unemployment.

Not only teachers, non teaching staff i.e. Drivers, Admin, Accountants, Cleaners etc along with informal jobs in that area.Plus, the multiplier effect thereof.

Another masterstroke.

Because rich and influential get automatic entry into fields like Politics and Bollywood. You should recognise how fucked up they are...
I don't think spreading this to all areas is good.

It will spread to all areas. LET IT. Not like they are gonna work in government sector because if their score. If they work in private sector and take money from other rich people, aint a problem. Why should we be bothered whether they become doctors or not ?
cleaned_text: health ministry reduces neet pg cutoff zero percentile year times india conduct exam claim exam filter bad candidates also claim rich people loads money get seats automatically private colleges finally let everyone kind fuckery letting everyone need entrance test
